DataElement.preferredName: Investigational Biospecimen Tissue Processing Clinical Study Protocol Or Quality Control Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that identifies the experimental biospecimen protocol or quality control procedures used in specimen processing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigational Biospecimen Tissue Processing Clinical Study Protocol Or Quality Control Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: In the process of being studied; experimental._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Cleaning and preparation of tissues for further use in biological products._A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The operational techniques and activities undertaken within the quality assurance system to verify that the requirements for quality of the trial related activities have been fulfilled. [ICH]_One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: In the process of being studied; experimental.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: In the process of being studied; experimental.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Tissue Processing Clinical Study Protocol Or Quality Control Identifier
Property.preferredDefinition: Cleaning and preparation of tissues for further use in biological products.:A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The operational techniques and activities undertaken within the quality assurance system to verify that the requirements for quality of the trial related activities have been fulfilled. [ICH]:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Cleaning and preparation of tissues for further use in biological products.

A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Set of measurements and inspections taken to verify that performance of equipment and procedures remains within specified limits.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

PermissibleValues.value: QC FFPE Section: 23 Hours in fixative
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Quality Control Formaldehyde Fixed Specimen Paraffin Embedded Tissue 23 Hour Fixative

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Quality Control Formaldehyde Fixed Specimen Paraffin Embedded Tissue 23 Hour Fixative
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The operational techniques and activities undertaken within the quality assurance system to verify that the requirements for quality of the trial related activities have been fulfilled. [ICH]: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.: Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::23: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.: A compound that preserves tissues and cells for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: Set of measurements and inspections taken to verify that performance of equipment and procedures remains within specified limits.

A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A compound that preserves tissues and cells for microscopic study.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Quality Control Formaldehyde Fixed Specimen Paraffin Embedded Tissue Middle Left 23 Hour Fixative
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The operational techniques and activities undertaken within the quality assurance system to verify that the requirements for quality of the trial related activities have been fulfilled. [ICH]: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.: Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.: An intermediate part or section; an area that is approximately central within some larger region.: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::23: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.: A compound that preserves tissues and cells for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: Set of measurements and inspections taken to verify that performance of equipment and procedures remains within specified limits.

A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
An intermediate part or section; an area that is approximately central within some larger region.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A compound that preserves tissues and cells for microscopic study.
